result.execSummary:
The defendant James Adrian Graham was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: The State found in-compliance with victim rights legislation. The Court orders restitution set at zero. Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments during the probation period in 14CF4180 under the same terms set in that matter.

Based on Good Time Credit; Court deems this to be a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
- NO CONTACT with Austin D. and Kerri B.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Adrian Graham

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Adrian Graham in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant James Adrian Graham in custody.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.  

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

COUNT 1:  The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes Section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.  

COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on state's motion, the Court orders Count 2 DISMISSED AND READ-IN for the purpose of sentencing. 


Statements made as to sentencing by the state, Austin D., defense, and defendant.

COUNT 1:  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 57 DAYS time served.  Base on good time credit the Court deems this to be a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

The state found in compliance with victim rights legislation.  The Court orders restitution set at zero.  The Court ordered the defendant to pay applicable costs, surcharges and assessments during the probation period in 14CF004180 under the same terms set in that matter.  The Court orders NO CONTACT with Austin D. and Kerri B.

Filed,
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement (copy given to defendant);
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant James Adrian Graham not in court, in custody.  
Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Status conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations. 
Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Mary Garvin Guimont in court, defendant James Adrian Graham not in court, in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations for global resolution with 14CF004180.  Defense request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court modifies the No Contact Order to include Keri B.
NO CONTACT ORDER STILL IN EFFECT.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant James Adrian Graham in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant James Adrian Graham in custody.  Ron Dague for Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Austin D.

Defendant James Adrian Graham in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant James Adrian Graham in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY to Count 1. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
